messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest
messages.msgSnippet: hi, yes but don t cut out too much you don t want to lose the context which i think happens from time to time. jmo, susan, austin tx
messages.messageBody:
hi,

yes but don't cut out too much you don't want to lose the context
which i think happens from time to time.

jmo,
susan,
austin tx

> I personally find it useful to
> include the relevant part(s) of the message I'm replying to, but
> PLEASE use that ol' pair of scissors when replying with the original
> message included.
>
> Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest
messages.msgSnippet: ... of an e- I personally find it useful to ... does
messages.messageBody:
>
> As I said before, I've returned home from a week away to find 37
> digests for this group in my inbox. Now, while I'm glad to see that
> this list is 'thriving,' (now where did I put that 'the life-cycle
of an e-
I personally find it useful to
> include the relevant part(s) of the message I'm replying to, but
> PLEASE use that ol' pair of scissors when replying with the original
> message included. Also, since the time-frame (and potential
> volume of email) can be very variable from original to reply, it
does
> help to follow the thread if the relevant part is included.
>
> Please, folks, spare a thought for those on digest!!
>
